description.narrative: By 2020, Government has strengthened legislative and policy frameworks to improve access to equitable and inclusive quality pre- school and general education services, which contributes to Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equitable Access To Quality Education (Covid), Learning Outcomes, Learning Outcomes (Covid), Skills Development, Skills Development (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 4. By 2020, girls and boys benefit equitably from improved preschool education and enhanced quality of basic education including in emergencies.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2020, Government has strengthened legislative and policy frameworks to improve access to equitable and inclusive quality pre- school and general education services

description.narrative: Development of Education Quality Assurance (QA) framework, standards, indicators and data collection instruments and guidelines are expected to facilitate evidence-based quality improvement measures in preschools and schools; and articulation of competency-based teacher professional standards and qualification framework is aimed at revitalizing teaching workforce quality and development. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2019

title.narrative: Number of draft revised legislation and policies to support inclusive and equitable access to quality education
Availability of conceptual framework, guidelines and tools for introduction of supportive supervision in education sector
Capacity of key staff at MOPSE is developed to implement and use EMIS for monitoring and evidence-based planning

actual.value: 2019:EMIS used for planning new preschools and for admissions
2019:ESP 2019-2023 was approved by Global Partnership for Education (GPE) in January 2019

title.narrative: Availability of data collection tools to measure quality education indicators as per national education quality framework

actual.value: 2019:Education Quality Assurance framework and tools piloted

title.narrative: System Strengthening - Education sector planning - Education Sector Plan or Transitional Education Sector Plan developed with UNICEF support available

actual.value: 2019:Education Sector Plan 2019-2023 was approved by the Global Partnership for Education and now government's official document for education sector development

title.narrative: Availability of electronic Education Management Information System (EMIS) in preschool education

actual.value: 2019:Preschool EMIS is fully functional for the designed indicators
